definition: implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
to have quite a lasting charm

sentences.english: With flavor and aroma of baking, after drinking halls.
sentences.chinese: 带焙火的韵味与香气，饮后令人回味无穷。

sentences.english: The portrait, painted in a simple but elegant style, has a romantic flavor.
sentences.chinese: 画面墨淡气雅，设色颇有浪漫主义韵味。

sentences.english: After supper, walking by the flowers and under the moon has a unique lingering charm .
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后，在花前月下散步别有一番韵味。

sentences.english: Her singing has a special pleasing quality about it.

sentences.chinese: 这四个T头韵押得有韵味。

sentences.english: They all are good, just different style, we should taste them from different sides.
sentences.chinese: 它们都美，只是韵味儿不同，要从不同的角度来欣赏。

sentences.english: The design of concise, double-color shoes after careful strappy more add flavor of leg ministry line.
sentences.chinese: 双色鞋的设计简洁，细致的后绊带更添腿部线条韵味。

sentences.english: Amazing taste with Chinese atomosphere. P. S.
sentences.chinese: 奇妙的味道中带着中国韵味。

sentences.english: Like any other translation it should convey the meaning and the music of the source language.
sentences.chinese: 像其他翻译一样，它应该传达源语言的意义和韵味。

sentences.english: Charm still often said that a person is to stay because of the aroma.
sentences.chinese: 常常说某人韵味犹存，就是久留的香气的缘故。

sentences.english: The new building is a massive body that ends the rhythm of original facade, marked by four roughly equidistant buttresses.
sentences.chinese: 而原有的四个等距扶壁则为厚重的建筑增添一丝韵味。

sentences.english: His play has endless charm, is implicit and poetry-rich.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧作含蓄蕴藉，韵味无穷，富含浓郁的诗情。

sentences.english: And in fact, the connotation and lasting appeal of this novel is much more rich and generous.
sentences.chinese: 而事实上，这部作品的内涵和韵味却更加丰厚。

sentences.english: And in fact, the connotation andlasting appeal of this novel is much more rich and generous.
sentences.chinese: 而事实上，这部作品的内涵和韵味却更加丰厚。

sentences.english: The translation is faithful to the original version, and with emphasis on the rhymes, attached Chinese phonetic symbols.
sentences.chinese: 译文既忠实原文，又注意韵味，并附有汉语拼音注音。

sentences.english: Conventional study furniture cooperates to be decorated compactly , can reflect a lasting appeal more.
sentences.chinese: 传统书房家具配合简洁的装修，更能体现出韵味。

definition: to have quite a lasting charm
mien/bearing/grace/amorous feelings/flirtatious expressions/local conditions and customs/wind force, direction etc
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
